node.title: 130 Years Later
node.description: The history of the Seventh-day Adventist Church was changed forever in 1888. 130 years later there is still talk and discussion about that General Conference Session. Why and what is the talk about? Does it matter in these last days? Elder A. G. Daniels, past president of the General Conference said, “In 1888 there came to the Seventh-day Adventist Church a very definite awakening message.” To set the stage for our week’s study we will review the history surrounding this remarkable event.
